page.title: 01HOPTON/GASTHORPE AREA
page.content: This area, boarded by the A1066, is mainly agricultural consisting of barley, sugar-beet, potatoes and dairy farming. Hopton, the largest settle- ment here, consists of a church, two chapels, a post office, a public house and various small shops. From the village, Hopton Fen slopes down to the River Little Ouse which flows from west to east across the centre of the area. Rough grassland surrounds Gasthorpe on the north side of the river and it has a post office and a few houses. An old roman road runs north from Gasthorpe to East Harling. The area has covets planted for shooting purposes. The airfield in the south-west corner is now used privately. Strips of deciduous wood- land border the road. The 40 acres of Riddlesworth Hall contains the Parish Church and two other houses.
